content:
Original: 
The timer changes based on players joining.
Edited(and moved from the first line to second): 
The timer stop time changes based on players joining.

Original:
Every time a player joins the clash, the game is set to start at 
Edited:
Every time a player joins the clash, the timer stop time is set to 

Original: 
where t is current time in seconds and p is the number of players in the room.
Edited: 
where t is current time in seconds and p is the number of players in the room before the new player joined.

Original: 
 If a player joins at the same time the game is supposed to start, set the new time
instead of starting the game.
Edited: 
If a player joins at the same time the game is supposed to start, set the new timer stop time
instead of starting the game.

I've changed difficulty to Easy.

I've added the tag "Time".

at 4:47 a player joins -> if it starts 256 seconds from now, it means you consider p to be 0 at that time. That's doubly non-sequitur from the rest of the wording.

I'd suggest you phrased everything in terms of "players currently in the room".

Noted. Though it is a bit hard to word it correctly, because the one who started the clash is the first player, and the formula becomes t -256/(2^(p-1)). 
Btw, did someone change the formula from monospace to variable?

I've edited the statement:

Goal
* Formatted "t" and "p" as [[variables]].
* Very minor changes in the wording.

Input
* Changed the description of the first line, from:
Positive integer [[n]]
to:
An integer [[n]] for the number of players who join the clash

As [[n]] may be 0, the original description was inaccurate.

I'll certainly ackowledge it's tricky to word properly.

If it was edited, it's not me.
